meanings.sent1: The sharp edges of the broken glass were quite disserviceable.
meanings.sent2: Using a rusty tool can be very disserviceable to your project.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel found the garden hose disserviceable for its acorn storage.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury was disserviceable to the fragile roof, tearing off shingles.
meanings.sent5: The dragon's fiery breath was disserviceable to the village, scorching everything in its path.

meanings.sent1: Wearing wet shoes is quite disserviceable on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: Ignoring the warning signs can be disserviceable to your safety.
meanings.sent3: The magician's disappearing act was disserviceable to his reputation when he couldn't reappear.
meanings.sent4: The faulty compass was disserviceable, leading the hikers in circles.
meanings.sent5: The expired medicine was disserviceable, causing more harm than good to the patient.
